sect1.title: Pth-&pth-version;

sect2.title: Installation of Pth

caution.para: Don't add the --enable-pthread parameter to the configure command below else you will overwrite the pthread library and interface header installed by the Glibc package in LFS.

sect2.para: Install Pth by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: sed -i 's#$(LOBJS): Makefile#$(LOBJS): pth_p.h Makefile#' Makefile.in && ./configure --prefix=/usr \ --disable-static \ --mandir=/usr/share/man && make

sect2.para: To test the results, issue: make test.

screen.userinput: make install && install -v -m755 -d /usr/share/doc/pth-&pth-version; && install -v -m644 README PORTING SUPPORT TESTS \ /usr/share/doc/pth-&pth-version;

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: sed -i 's#$(LOBJS) ...: This sed fixes a race condition in the Makefile. It allows you to run make with multiple jobs (e.g., make -j4) .
--disable-static: This option stops it compiling a static version of the library.
--mandir=/usr/share/man: This option puts the man pages in /usr/share/man and not /usr/man.

listitem.para: is a utility used to configure and build applications based on the pth(3) library. It can be used to query the C compiler and linker flags which are required to correctly compile and link the application against the pth(3) library.
contains the API functions used by the GNU Portable Threads Library.
